summary: The rising opioid epidemic has contributed to an increase in the number of babies born with neonatal abstinence syndrome—a withdrawal condition with symptoms including excessive crying and difficulty breathing. The Department of Health and Human Services identified key recommendations to help guide its efforts to prevent and treat this syndrome—such as providing medical education to healthcare providers on how to treat these infants. title: Newborn Health: Federal Action Needed to Address Neonatal Abstinence Syndrome
